# Clear Workspace

```{r}
rm(list = ls())
```

# Load Libraries

```{r}
library('tidyverse')
library('broom')
```

# Load data

```{r}
#| message: false
diabetes_data <- read_tsv(file = "../data/04_diabetes_data_augment.tsv",
                          na = "NA")
```

For PCA analysis we drop the observations that have NA values. We will use the observations that are not medicated, and use the anthropometric measures and biomarkers.

```{r}
model_data <- diabetes_data |> 
  filter(medication == 0) |> 
  select(diagnosis,weight,height,leg,arml,armc,waist,tri_skinfold,sub_skinfold,gh,albumin,bun,creatinine) |> 
  mutate(diagnosis = factor(diagnosis)) |> 
  drop_na()
```

# Do PCA

```{r}
pca_fit <- model_data |> 
  select(-diagnosis) |> 
  select(where(is.numeric)) |> 
  scale() |> 
  prcomp()
```

# Plot PCA

```{r}
pca_fit |> 
  augment(model_data) |> 
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = .fittedPC1, 
                       y = .fittedPC2,
                       color = diagnosis)) +
  geom_point(mapping = aes(alpha = 0.1)) + 
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = 'Data represented by the first two principal components',
       x = 'Principal Component 1',
       y = 'Principal Component 2') +
  theme_bw(base_size = 14) +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5)) 
```




# Variance explained by the principal components

```{r}
pca_fit |> 
  tidy(matrix = 'eigenvalues') |> 
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = PC,
                       y = percent)) +
  geom_col(fill = 'deepskyblue3',
           alpha = 0.7) +
  theme_minimal() +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = 1:13) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0,0.4),
                     labels = scales::percent_format(),
                     expand = c(0,0)) +
  labs(title = 'Variance explained by each principal component',
       x = 'Principal Component',
       y = 'Variance explained (percent)') +
  theme_bw(base_size = 14) +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5)) 
```
